entries.title: Historic religious statue returns to Italy with support of Eurojust

title_detail.value: Historic religious statue returns to Italy with support of Eurojust

entries.summary: The historic Italian statue of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, which holds great religious importance, has been returned to Italy from the Netherlands with judicial support from Eurojust. The religious artefact was stolen in 2014 from a church in Pastena on the Amalfi Coast and later bought by a Dutch collector. The Agency assisted the Italian authorities with the rapid execution of a European Investigation Order (EIO) to arrange for its return to the Pastena parish.

summary_detail.value: The historic Italian statue of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, which holds great religious importance, has been returned to Italy from the Netherlands with judicial support from Eurojust. The religious artefact was stolen in 2014 from a church in Pastena on the Amalfi Coast and later bought by a Dutch collector. The Agency assisted the Italian authorities with the rapid execution of a European Investigation Order (EIO) to arrange for its return to the Pastena parish.

content.value: The statue, which is around 700 years old, was stolen from the church in August 2014 and offered for sale via an Italian antique dealer. It was bought in good faith by a Dutch collector who intended to resell it and posted pictures on social media. These were spotted by the parish priest of Pastena, who contacted the Italian authorities. An investigation was launched by the special Cultural Heritage Unit of the Italian Carabinieri and the Public Prosecutor’s Office of Salerno, which later contacted Eurojust to initiate the process of retrieving and returning the artefact to the Amalfi Coast.…

entries.title: SIRIUS 2023 report: Navigating the new era of obtaining electronic evidence

title_detail.value: SIRIUS 2023 report: Navigating the new era of obtaining electronic evidence

entries.summary: Today, Europol, Eurojust and the European Judicial Network publish the 2023 edition of the SIRIUS European Union (EU) Electronic Evidence Situation Report.This report was first presented at the SIRIUS Annual Conference which saw over 900 participants take part in this hybrid event between 21-23 November 2023.The latest SIRIUS publication outlines the experiences of EU authorities in retrieving electronic data held by foreign-based service providers, and their experiences in delivering data, for the purpose of criminal investigations over the past year.

summary_detail.value: Today, Europol, Eurojust and the European Judicial Network publish the 2023 edition of the SIRIUS European Union (EU) Electronic Evidence Situation Report.This report was first presented at the SIRIUS Annual Conference which saw over 900 participants take part in this hybrid event between 21-23 November 2023.The latest SIRIUS publication outlines the experiences of EU authorities in retrieving electronic data held by foreign-based service providers, and their experiences in delivering data, for the purpose of criminal investigations over the past year.

content.value: SIRIUS EU Electronic Evidence Situation Report 2023Download the reportThe report highlights the new frontier of electronic evidenceThe EU Electronic Evidence legislative package, adopted in July 2023, marks a new era in obtaining electronic evidence, as it will enable competent authorities to issue legally binding orders directly to service providers offering services within the EU, regardless of their place of establishment. This move will help address issues regarding lengthy judicial procedures to obtain data across borders, as well as legal uncertainties surrounding practices of voluntary…

entries.title: Joint action in Germany and Italy against money laundering via rental of luxury cars

title_detail.value: Joint action in Germany and Italy against money laundering via rental of luxury cars

entries.summary: Eurojust has assisted the German and Italian authorities in a coordinated action against large-scale money laundering through the fake long-term rental of mainly luxury cars. Seven suspects were arrested across the two countries for using a car hire agency to launder the proceeds of drug trafficking, extortion and illegal betting for other criminals. The enterprise has been seized in addition to a real estate complex and nearly one hundred mainly luxury vehicles.

summary_detail.value: Eurojust has assisted the German and Italian authorities in a coordinated action against large-scale money laundering through the fake long-term rental of mainly luxury cars. Seven suspects were arrested across the two countries for using a car hire agency to launder the proceeds of drug trafficking, extortion and illegal betting for other criminals. The enterprise has been seized in addition to a real estate complex and nearly one hundred mainly luxury vehicles.

content.value: The criminal network primarily used a German-registered car rental agency, which rented out over 150 vehicles for periods of three to four years to customers in Italy. Via fake long-term rental contracts, German-registered luxury cars were delivered to the Italian clients, who paid for their monthly instalments with the proceedings of criminal activities. The arrested suspects are linked to the camorra mafia-type criminal organisation in Italy.Both the judiciary in Germany and Italy started investigations into the case in 2019, with Eurojust enabling close cooperation between the authorities…

entries.field_list_image_1: Eurojust support to justice for Ukraine
entries.summary: Eurojust support to justice for UkraineOn 4 December, Mr Ladislav Hamran (President of Eurojust) informed the EU’s Justice and Home Affairs Council on the latest developments at Eurojust on working towards accountability for Russian war crimes in Ukraine. Ministers were updated on the state of play of the Joint Investigation Team’s work (JIT), the International Centre for the Prosecution of the Crime of Aggression against Ukraine (ICPA) as well as on the Core International Crimes Evidence Database (CICED).

Ministers were updated on the state of play of the Joint Investigation Team’s work (JIT), the International Centre for the Prosecution of the Crime of Aggression against Ukraine (ICPA) as well as on the Core International Crimes Evidence Database (CICED).

content.value: Eurojust continued to support Member States who have joined the JIT (EE, LT, LV, PL, RO, SK ) with legal advice, logistic arrangements financial assistance amounting to nearly 300.000 EUR in grants at present. With investigations currently ongoing, the JIT can further rely on the support of Eurojust, Europol, the International Criminal Court and the United States. On the ICPA, President Hamran informed ministers about a USD 1 million contribution to its operations by the United States. The financial support comes in addition to the US Special Prosecutor at the ICPA who joined the ICPA in…

entries.title: New National Member for Portugal at Eurojust takes up duties

title_detail.value: New National Member for Portugal at Eurojust takes up duties

entries.summary: Mr José Luis Ferreira TrindadeMr José Luis Ferreira Trindade has been appointed Eurojust National Member for Portugal as of 8 November 2023. He replaces Mr António Cluny who has been the National Member since 2014. Mr Ferreira Trindade has been serving as Deputy National Member for Portugal since September 2020. Prior to that, he started working at Eurojust in July 2016 as Assistant to the National Member.

He replaces Mr António Cluny who has been the National Member since 2014. Mr Ferreira Trindade has been serving as Deputy National Member for Portugal since September 2020. Prior to that, he started working at Eurojust in July 2016 as Assistant to the National Member.

content.value: Commenting on his new role as National Member, Mr Ferreira Trindade said: I am honoured to be appointed as National Member for Portugal at Eurojust. During the seven years that I have been part of the Eurojust family, I have seen the Agency play an increasingly important role in combating cross-border crime. In my new role as National Member, I look forward to continue working closely with all the other Member States to make Europe a safer place for everyone.Mr Ferreira Trindade has worked as a Public Prosecutor since 1990 at different levels of the Public Prosecution Service in Portugal. entries.title: SIRIUS Annual Conference 2023

title_detail.value: SIRIUS Annual Conference 2023

entries.field_list_image_1: Vincent Jamin speaking at SIRIUS Conference, 2023
entries.summary: On 21-23 November 2023, the SIRIUS Project held its fifth Annual Conference. The hybrid event, focused on cross-border access to electronic evidence, was attended by over 900 participants, including representatives from law enforcement and judicial authorities from 38 countries, as well as 20 representatives of service providers. The event highlighted the crucial need for a collaborative effort to effectively implement forthcoming electronic evidence policies.

summary_detail.value: On 21-23 November 2023, the SIRIUS Project held its fifth Annual Conference. The hybrid event, focused on cross-border access to electronic evidence, was attended by over 900 participants, including representatives from law enforcement and judicial authorities from 38 countries, as well as 20 representatives of service providers. The event highlighted the crucial need for a collaborative effort to effectively implement forthcoming electronic evidence policies.

content.value: During the three-day event, the participants had the opportunity to participate in a variety of discussions ranging from the project’s latest achievements, emerging technologies, and the related challenges in obtaining electronic evidence. The legislative developments in this field taking place in the EU and worldwide formed an important part of the conversation from the perspective of policy makers, practitioners, and service providers alike.The SIRIUS Annual Conference 2023 programme included:Interactive panel discussions on novel legal instruments for obtaining electronic evidence across…

entries.title: Ransomware group dismantled in Ukraine in a major international operation supported by Eurojust and Europol

title_detail.value: Ransomware group dismantled in Ukraine in a major international operation supported by Eurojust and Europol

entries.summary: Judicial and law enforcement authorities from seven different countries have joined forces in an action against a criminal network responsible for significant ransomware attacks across the world. These attacks are believed to have affected over 1,800 victims in 71 countries. The perpetrators targeted large corporations, effectively bringing their business to a standstill and causing losses of at least several hundred millions of euros. A recent operation supported by Eurojust and Europol led to the arrest of the ringleader and the detention of four suspects in Ukraine. A total of 30 places were searched and over a hundred digital equipment tools were seized.

summary_detail.value: Judicial and law enforcement authorities from seven different countries have joined forces in an action against a criminal network responsible for significant ransomware attacks across the world. These attacks are believed to have affected over 1,800 victims in 71 countries. The perpetrators targeted large corporations, effectively bringing their business to a standstill and causing losses of at least several hundred millions of euros. A recent operation supported by Eurojust and Europol led to the arrest of the ringleader and the detention of four suspects in Ukraine. A total of 30 places were searched and over a hundred digital equipment tools were seized.

content.value: More than 20 investigators from Norway, France, Germany and the United States were deployed to Kyiv to assist the Ukrainian authorities. This latest action follows a first round of arrests in 2021 in the framework of the same investigation. The perpetrators are believed to have played different roles in the criminal network. Some were involved in the infiltration attempts, using multiple mechanisms to compromise IT networks, including brute force attacks, so-called SQL injection techniques to attack data applications, stolen credentials and phishing emails with malicious attachments. entries.summary: On 22 and 23 November 2023, the Eurojust Annual Meeting on Counter-Terrorism gathered national correspondents for Eurojust for terrorism matters, specialised prosecutors from both EU Member States and third countries, as well as representatives from EU institutions and international organisations.

entries.title: 34th Genocide Network meeting

title_detail.value: 34th Genocide Network meeting

entries.summary: The 34th Genocide Network meeting on 15-16 November 2023 focused on the investigation and prosecution of core international crimes committed by ISIL against the Yazidi community in Iraq and Syria. With many ongoing investigations and prosecutions of crimes committed by EU nationals joining ISIL and repatriations presenting possible new cases, the topic proved highly relevant and timely. Speakers from a variety of backgrounds and with unique insights into the topic delivered presentations on the legal complexities of such cases and engaged the audience in practical discussions.

summary_detail.value: The 34th Genocide Network meeting on 15-16 November 2023 focused on the investigation and prosecution of core international crimes committed by ISIL against the Yazidi community in Iraq and Syria. entries.title: Europol and Eurojust support Czech and Ukrainian police in taking down multi-million euro voice phishing gang

title_detail.value: Europol and Eurojust support Czech and Ukrainian police in taking down multi-million euro voice phishing gang

entries.summary: The Czech and Ukrainian police have disrupted, with the support of Europol and Eurojust, a prolific phishing gang believed to have defrauded victims across Europe of tens of millions of euros. In Czechia alone, the damage caused by this criminal group is estimated at over EUR 8 million (CZK 195 000 000). As a result of this investigation, six suspects were already arrested in Ukraine and four in the Czech Republic in April this year. Locations in Czechia (Domazlice, Rokycany and Plzen) and Ukraine (Dnipropetrovsk) were searched during the raids, including the homes of the accused, vehicles and call centres.

content.value: Photo credits: Czech PoliceMobile phones, SIM cards and computer equipment were seized during the crackdown.The criminal group operated from call centres located in Ukraine and carried out vishing – or voice phishing – attacks, mainly targeting Czech victims. The fraudsters asked them to transfer funds from their ‘compromised’ bank accounts to ‘safe’ bank accounts controlled by the criminals.The suspects used spoofed phone numbers and impersonated bank employees and police officers to gain the trust of their victims.European coordinationThe case was opened at Eurojust in November 2021 at the…

entries.title: Takedown of Belgian-Greek network smuggling migrants with fake documents by air, eleven arrests

title_detail.value: Takedown of Belgian-Greek network smuggling migrants with fake documents by air, eleven arrests

entries.summary: Authorities in Belgium and Greece have dismantled a network that was smuggling irregular migrants via Belgian airports to other European countries, including Norway. Mainly Iraqi migrants travelled from Greece to Charleroi and Brussels on falsified or stolen documents, paying at least between EUR 5 000 and EUR 6 000 per person. During an action day, with the active assistance of Eurojust and Europol, 11 people were arrested and 16 places searched, including two travel agencies in Athens.

summary_detail.value: Authorities in Belgium and Greece have dismantled a network that was smuggling irregular migrants via Belgian airports to other European countries, including Norway. Mainly Iraqi migrants travelled from Greece to Charleroi and Brussels on falsified or stolen documents, paying at least between EUR 5 000 and EUR 6 000 per person. During an action day, with the active assistance of Eurojust and Europol, 11 people were arrested and 16 places searched, including two travel agencies in Athens.

content.value: Investigations in Belgium into the smuggling network started in April 2022, after the interception at Brussels airport of a facilitator accompanying three irregular migrants. These investigations uncovered an organised crime group (OCG), which facilitated the travel of small groups of two to four irregular migrants from Greece to Belgium. The migrants had previously travelled to Greece through irregular channels. The journeys between Greek and Belgian airports were made by using falsified, stolen or ‘look-alike’ identity documents. During their journey, the migrants were accompanied by…

entries.title: Eurojust and Nigerian judicial authorities sign Working Arrangement to boost cooperation against organised crime

title_detail.value: Eurojust and Nigerian judicial authorities sign Working Arrangement to boost cooperation against organised crime

entries.field_list_image_1: Mr Lateef Olasunkanmi Fagbemi and Mr Ladislav Hamran
entries.summary: Eurojust and the Attorney General of Nigeria, Mr Lateef Olasunkanmi Fagbemi, SAN, signed on 9 November a Working Arrangement to enable structured and closer cooperation in the fight against organised crime groups (OCGs). This paves the way for the establishment of a Contact Point for Eurojust in Nigeria and closer communication for the swifter execution of requests for judicial cooperation on both sides. Nigeria is the first sub-Saharan African country to sign a Working Arrangement with the Agency.

The conference, which brings together judicial and law enforcement authorities from eight West African countries and most of the national authorities represented at Eurojust, is being organised by the Agency in cooperation with the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) and the Siracusa International Institute for Criminal Justice and Human Rights.The President of…

entries.title: Five right-wing terrorists arrested throughout Europe with the support of Eurojust and Europol

title_detail.value: Five right-wing terrorists arrested throughout Europe with the support of Eurojust and Europol

entries.summary: Eurojust and Europol have supported the competent authorities in Belgium, Croatia, Germany, Lithuania, Romania and Italy in an international operation against right-wing terrorism. During a joint action day, five suspects were apprehended and an additional seven others were interrogated. Furthermore, data carriers and weapons were seized.

summary_detail.value: Eurojust and Europol have supported the competent authorities in Belgium, Croatia, Germany, Lithuania, Romania and Italy in an international operation against right-wing terrorism. During a joint action day, five suspects were apprehended and an additional seven others were interrogated. Furthermore, data carriers and weapons were seized.

content.value: The suspects allegedly belong to a right-wing organisation that uses an online platform for terrorism related activities, including the dissemination of violent extremist propaganda, the active recruitment of new members and the sharing of manuals of 3D-printed weapons. Some of the members of the organisation are believed to have written their own manifesto and to have access to weapons. Despite of the young age of some of the suspects, indicators showed that there was an increased risk that some of them would take action soon.The case was opened by Eurojust in July 2023 at the request of the…

entries.title: Eurojust supports international operation against tax evasion through sham contracts

title_detail.value: Eurojust supports international operation against tax evasion through sham contracts

entries.summary: Eurojust has supported the competent authorities in Germany, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Poland in a coordinated action against a group of suspects allegedly involved in tax evasion through sham contracts with foreign subcontractors. During an operation on 10 October, 39 business premises and apartments were simultaneously searched in all countries involved and several witnesses were questioned.

summary_detail.value: Eurojust has supported the competent authorities in Germany, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Poland in a coordinated action against a group of suspects allegedly involved in tax evasion through sham contracts with foreign subcontractors. During an operation on 10 October, 39 business premises and apartments were simultaneously searched in all countries involved and several witnesses were questioned.

content.value: The perpetrators allegedly concluded sham contracts with subcontractors in Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Poland in order to conceal employment relationships in Germany. They are also alleged to have partly exploited the different minimum wage standards in the European Union Member States concerned to evade millions of euros in taxes. The case was opened at Eurojust in May 2023 at the request of the German law enforcement authorities. Eurojust facilitated the communication, exchange of information and coordination between the national authorities in real time during the joint action day. The…

entries.title: Actions across Europe against online fraud with cryptocurrencies

title_detail.value: Actions across Europe against online fraud with cryptocurrencies

entries.summary: At the request of the Swiss authorities, Eurojust has coordinated several actions against an online fraud network in EU Member States, Georgia and Ukraine. This has led to searches and the freezing of bank accounts in over 20 countries.

summary_detail.value: At the request of the Swiss authorities, Eurojust has coordinated several actions against an online fraud network in EU Member States, Georgia and Ukraine. This has led to searches and the freezing of bank accounts in over 20 countries.

content.value: Investigations into the investment scam started in October 2019, following a complaint from a victim to the Swiss authorities. This uncovered fraudulent call centres and websites of alleged financial trading companies in Ukraine, and later also in Georgia. The investigation was temporarily suspended due to the war in Ukraine. At the end of 2022, however, targeted actions were taken in 23 countries, where places were searched and bank accounts and assets were frozen. The investigations revealed that most of the victims were Swiss and German investors. The perpetrators allegedly used over a…

entries.title: Fight against terrorism across EU strengthened by more information sharing with Eurojust

title_detail.value: Fight against terrorism across EU strengthened by more information sharing with Eurojust

entries.field_list_image_1: Picture of soldiers with overlay in top-right Eurojust logo
entries.summary: The joint efforts across the European Union to fight terrorism will be stepped up by judicial authorities sharing a wider range of information on terrorism cases with Eurojust. EU Member States have an improved legal basis to inform on ongoing and concluded terrorism cases with the entry into force today of an amendment of the Eurojust Regulation. These data will be transmitted to the European Judicial Counter-Terrorism Register (CTR) managed by Eurojust. This will help to better detect links between terrorism cases or connections with other serious crimes.

summary_detail.value: The joint efforts across the European Union to fight terrorism will be stepped up by judicial authorities sharing a wider range of information on terrorism cases with Eurojust. EU Member States have an improved legal basis to inform on ongoing and concluded terrorism cases with the entry into force today of an amendment of the Eurojust Regulation. These data will be transmitted to the European Judicial Counter-Terrorism Register (CTR) managed by Eurojust. This will help to better detect links between terrorism cases or connections with other serious crimes.

content.value: Commenting on the entry into force of the new Regulation, Eurojust President Mr Ladislav Hamran said: The recent attacks in Belgium and France confirm that the threat of terrorism on European soil is still very much alive. Close coordination and early information sharing are crucial ingredients in the successful fight against this heinous crime, and this is precisely what we expect to achieve by reinforcing the Counter-Terrorism Register. I also warmly welcome the other amendments to our Regulation concerning the modernisation of our Case Management System and the role of Liaison Prosecutors…

entries.title: Meeting on Mutual Legal Assistance Cooperation between the European Union and the United Kingdom

title_detail.value: Meeting on Mutual Legal Assistance Cooperation between the European Union and the United Kingdom

entries.summary: On 26 and 27 October 2023, a meeting on Mutual Legal Assistance Cooperation between the European Union and the United Kingdom was held at Eurojust’s premises and online.

summary_detail.value: On 26 and 27 October 2023, a meeting on Mutual Legal Assistance Cooperation between the European Union and the United Kingdom was held at Eurojust’s premises and online.

content.value: The legal system in the UK is significantly different from that of most legal systems in the EU and other countries, and it is therefore crucial to know and understand the differences to enable smooth cooperation. Furthermore, since 1 January 2021, a new legal regime between the EU and UK, the Trade and Cooperation Agreement, became applicable. This implied some relevant changes in different fields of judicial cooperation in criminal matters, such as mutual legal assistance (MLA). In addition, the MLA form, which was created in accordance with Article 635 of the TCA, became mandatory as of 1…

entries.title: Coordinated arrest of Swedish high-value target suspected of major drug trafficking

title_detail.value: Coordinated arrest of Swedish high-value target suspected of major drug trafficking

entries.summary: Eurojust has supported the authorities in Sweden, Serbia and Montenegro in the arrest of a Swedish national suspected of being part of an organised crime group (OCG) involved in drug trafficking. After his arrest in Serbia, a procedure was initiated for his extradition to Sweden. During a joint action day also supported by Interpol, the authorities conducted house searches in Serbia and Montenegro and seized important evidence.

summary_detail.value: Eurojust has supported the authorities in Sweden, Serbia and Montenegro in the arrest of a Swedish national suspected of being part of an organised crime group (OCG) involved in drug trafficking. After his arrest in Serbia, a procedure was initiated for his extradition to Sweden. During a joint action day also supported by Interpol, the authorities conducted house searches in Serbia and Montenegro and seized important evidence.

content.value: The suspect, previously convicted for similar crimes, is suspected of both aggravated narcotics- and weapon-offences, and illegal possession of explosives. He has recently been residing in the Balkans, from where he is believed to have continued his criminal activities in Sweden. He allegedly controlled his subordinates in the OCG remotely and directed them to carry out several criminal activities, such as the trade of vast quantities of narcotics and weapons. Some of his accomplices have been already convicted and others are under criminal investigation. At the request of the Swedish…

entries.title: Major international operation against the Ragnar Locker ransomware group with Eurojust support

title_detail.value: Major international operation against the Ragnar Locker ransomware group with Eurojust support

entries.summary: An international operation coordinated by France, with the support of Eurojust and Europol, has dealt an important blow to the Ragnar Locker ransomware group. In an action carried out between 16 and 20 October, searches were conducted in three different countries and in total six suspects were heard in the Czech Republic, Spain, Latvia and France. Furthermore, nine servers were taken down; five in the Netherlands, two in Germany and two in Sweden. The organised crime group is suspected of having committed attacks against 168 international companies worldwide since 2020.At the end of the action week, the main perpetrator, suspected of being a developer of the Ragnar group, has been brought in front of the examining magistrates of the Paris Judicial Court.

summary_detail.value: An international operation coordinated by France, with the support of Eurojust and Europol, has dealt an important blow to the Ragnar Locker ransomware group. In an action carried out between 16 and 20 October, searches were conducted in three different countries and in total six suspects were heard in the Czech Republic, Spain, Latvia and France. Furthermore, nine servers were taken down; five in the Netherlands, two in Germany and two in Sweden. The organised crime group is suspected of having committed attacks against 168 international companies worldwide since 2020.At the end of the action week, the main perpetrator, suspected of being a developer of the Ragnar group, has been brought in front of the examining magistrates of the Paris Judicial Court.

content.value: The criminals would use malware and steal sensitive data from companies before encrypting their files. They would then offer a decryption key in return for a ransom payment ranging from 5 to 70 million dollars, threatening to leak the stolen data on the dark web if their demands were not met.This major international operation follows two previous actions conducted against the same ransomware group. In September 2021, a coordinated strike between the French, Ukrainian and the United States' authorities led to the arrest of two suspects in Ukraine. In October 2022, another suspect was arrested…

entries.title: Attorney General of Colombia visits Eurojust to step up cooperation against drug and wildlife trafficking

title_detail.value: Attorney General of Colombia visits Eurojust to step up cooperation against drug and wildlife trafficking

entries.field_list_image_1: Ms Margarita Šniutytė-Daugėlienė and Mr Francisco Barbosa
entries.summary: Ms Margarita Šniutytė-Daugėlienė and Mr Francisco BarbosaThe Attorney General of Colombia, Mr Francisco Barbosa, visited Eurojust today to discuss stepping up cross-border judicial cooperation with EU Member States through the Agency. A particular focus was on enhancing cooperation to combat the sharp increase in illicit drug and wildlife trafficking from Colombia to the European Union. Fighting these types of organised crimes are priorities for both the EU and the Colombian authorities.

summary_detail.value: Ms Margarita Šniutytė-Daugėlienė and Mr Francisco BarbosaThe Attorney General of Colombia, Mr Francisco Barbosa, visited Eurojust today to discuss stepping up cross-border judicial cooperation with EU Member States through the Agency. A particular focus was on enhancing cooperation to combat the sharp increase in illicit drug and wildlife trafficking from Colombia to the European Union. Fighting these types of organised crimes are priorities for both the EU and the Colombian authorities.

content.value: Eurojust Vice-President Ms Margarita Šniutytė-Daugėlienė stated: Together with drug trafficking, the trade in protected animals is a lucrative business for organised crime groups. With large-scale criminal organisations operating increasingly on a global scale, close cooperation with our partners around the world is of the highest importance. For this reason, we are very happy Mr Barbosa Delgado visited us today to discuss how we can improve our already excellent cooperation.Mr Barbosa, who currently holds the Presidency of the Ibero-American Association of Public Prosecutors (AIAMP), pointed…

entries.title: 20 migrant smugglers sentenced to prison in Belgium with Eurojust support

title_detail.value: 20 migrant smugglers sentenced to prison in Belgium with Eurojust support

entries.summary: The Belgian Court of Bruges sentenced 20 suspects today to prison terms ranging from 30 months to 11 years for their involvement in migrant smuggling. They were also ordered to pay fines of up to EUR 80 000.The suspects were arrested in July 2022 in an unprecedented international operation targeting a criminal network suspected of using small boats to smuggle up to 10 000 migrants across the English Channel. The action was carried out jointly by authorities in several countries, including Belgium, Germany, the Netherlands and the United Kingdom, with the support of Eurojust and Europol.

summary_detail.value: The Belgian Court of Bruges sentenced 20 suspects today to prison terms ranging from 30 months to 11 years for their involvement in migrant smuggling. They were also ordered to pay fines of up to EUR 80 000.The suspects were arrested in July 2022 in an unprecedented international operation targeting a criminal network suspected of using small boats to smuggle up to 10 000 migrants across the English Channel. The action was carried out jointly by authorities in several countries, including Belgium, Germany, the Netherlands and the United Kingdom, with the support of Eurojust and Europol.

content.value: Thanks to intensive cooperation and exchange of information, the authorities involved were able to deal a severe blow to one of the most significant crime groups involved in cross-Channel migrant smuggling. During an action day on 5 July 2022, 39 people were arrested and over 50 searches were carried out simultaneously in several countries.The organised crime group is believed to have facilitated the smuggling of Vietnamese nationals into the United Kingdom, among other things. To achieve this, the criminal network set up a large infrastructure. The investigation revealed that migrants were…

entries.title: National Experts on joint investigation teams explore ways of enhancing cooperation with Latin American countries

title_detail.value: National Experts on joint investigation teams explore ways of enhancing cooperation with Latin American countries

entries.summary: In recent years, judicial cooperation in criminal matters between EU and Latin American countries has intensified. This has given rise to the first four joint investigation teams (JITs) involving Argentina, Brazil and Ecuador being established with the support of Eurojust. The 19th Annual Meeting of the Network of National Experts on JITs explored how to step up judicial and law enforcement cooperation between EU Member States and Latin American countries in the fight against serious organised crime.

summary_detail.value: In recent years, judicial cooperation in criminal matters between EU and Latin American countries has intensified. This has given rise to the first four joint investigation teams (JITs) involving Argentina, Brazil and Ecuador being established with the support of Eurojust. The 19th Annual Meeting of the Network of National Experts on JITs explored how to step up judicial and law enforcement cooperation between EU Member States and Latin American countries in the fight against serious organised crime.

content.value: Latin American criminal networks play a major role in drug trafficking and often collaborate with EU-based criminal groups. As a result, vast quantities of cocaine are trafficked from Latin America to the EU, generating huge profits for criminals in both regions. This trade also fuels criminal enterprises, undermining the EU's economy, institutions and society. During the 19th Annual Meeting of National Experts on JITs, practitioners explored the need for and possibilities of establishing JITs with Latin American countries. The event was hosted by the JITs Network Secretariat at the Eurojust…

entries.title: New National Member for Malta, Maria Baldacchino, takes up duties

title_detail.value: New National Member for Malta, Maria Baldacchino, takes up duties

entries.summary: Ms Maria BaldacchinoMs Maria Baldacchino has taken up her duties as the new National Member for Malta at Eurojust this month, succeeding Mr Philip Galea Farrugia. Ms Baldacchino has already served as Deputy National Member since September 2021, combining this function with her work as a lawyer at the Office of the Attorney General in Valletta. She has worked at Eurojust as Assistant to the National Member since March 2020.

entries.title: Prosecutors General discuss stepping up judicial role in major operations against organised crime using EMPACT platform

title_detail.value: Prosecutors General discuss stepping up judicial role in major operations against organised crime using EMPACT platform

entries.field_list_image_1: Prosecutors General and Directors of Public Prosecutions of EU Member States
entries.summary: The Prosecutors General and Directors of Public Prosecutions of EU Member States have extensively discussed how to enhance the role of judicial authorities in joint operations against major organised crime via the EMPACT platform. This would mean involving public prosecutors at an earlier stage in the planning and coordination of operational actions. During their 17th Consultative Forum, held yesterday and today at Eurojust, they were also given an update on the state of play of the judicial response to the war in Ukraine and debated the challenges of protecting the environment through criminal law.

The 17th Consultative Forum of Prosecutors General and Directors of Public Prosecutions of EU Member States was organised together with the Swedish and Spanish authorities, in view of the Presidency of the Council of the European Union of both countries in 2023.Mr Thomas Häggström, Director of Public Prosecution of Sweden, stated: EMPACT has been operational for more than a decade and has proven to be a highly effective collaborative platform for law enforcement agencies. entries.title: Europol participates in joint investigation team into alleged core international crimes in Ukraine

title_detail.value: Europol participates in joint investigation team into alleged core international crimes in Ukraine

entries.field_list_image_1: Group signing of the JITs agreement
entries.summary: The European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation, Europol, has become a participant in the joint investigation team (JIT) on alleged core international crimes committed in Ukraine. The Prosecutors General of the JIT-partner countries involved and Ms Catherine De Bolle, Executive Director of Europol, signed the relevant documentation today during the 17th Meeting of the Consultative Forum of Prosecutors General at Eurojust.

summary_detail.value: The European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation, Europol, has become a participant in the joint investigation team (JIT) on alleged core international crimes committed in Ukraine. The Prosecutors General of the JIT-partner countries involved and Ms Catherine De Bolle, Executive Director of Europol, signed the relevant documentation today during the 17th Meeting of the Consultative Forum of Prosecutors General at Eurojust.

content.value: The JIT was set up on 25 March 2022 by Lithuania, Poland and Ukraine with Eurojust’s support. On 31 May 2022, Estonia, Latvia and Slovakia became members, followed by Romania on 13 October 2022. On 3 March 2023, the JIT’s seven national authorities signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the United States Department of Justice. Europol joins Eurojust and the Office of the Prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) as participants in the JIT.In line with its mandate, Europol will provide analytical and forensic support to the members of the JIT. entries.title: Larnaca Conference, 18th CrimEx and 2nd EMJNet meeting of the EuroMed Justice programme

title_detail.value: Larnaca Conference, 18th CrimEx and 2nd EMJNet meeting of the EuroMed Justice programme

entries.summary: Tackling migrant smuggling is at the heart of the EuroMed Justice (EMJ) multiannual 2022-25 strategy. With the active support of the Cypriot Ministry of Justice, several key actors had the opportunity to continue the exchanges started in Athens in 2022. Eurojust, the Secretariat of the European Judicial Network (EJN), judges, prosecutors, representatives of Member States’ ministries and law enforcement presented their work on the topic, and the challenges they face regarding international cooperation on this matter.

The CrimEx session assessed the implementation of the EMJ V Programme (2020-23) and its impact in South Partner Countries (SPCs). It also debated the strategic documents and priorities of the incoming 6th EMJ…

entries.title: Workshop on international cooperation provisions of the Second Additional Protocol to the Budapest Convention (Art. 9-10)

title_detail.value: Workshop on international cooperation provisions of the Second Additional Protocol to the Budapest Convention (Art. 9-10)

entries.summary: On 21 and 22 September 2023, a Workshop on international cooperation provisions of the Second Additional Protocol to the Budapest Convention (Art. 9-10), organised jointly by Eurojust and the Council of Europe, was held at Eurojust’s premises and online.

summary_detail.value: On 21 and 22 September 2023, a Workshop on international cooperation provisions of the Second Additional Protocol to the Budapest Convention (Art. 9-10), organised jointly by Eurojust and the Council of Europe, was held at Eurojust’s premises and online.

content.value: This event aimed to address the new procedures enhancing international cooperation between authorities for the disclosure of stored computer data included in the Second Additional Protocol. Discussions focused mainly on expedited disclosure of stored computer data in an emergency (Art. 9), as well as emergency mutual assistance (Art. 10), including the enhanced role of 24/7 Points of Contact established under the Budapest Convention.

entries.title: Two new Liaison Prosecutors take up duties at Eurojust

title_detail.value: Two new Liaison Prosecutors take up duties at Eurojust

entries.summary: Eurojust welcomes two new Liaison Prosecutors who recently took up duties at the Agency. For the first time, the Republic of Moldova has stationed a prosecutor at Eurojust’s headquarters in The Hague, with the aim of strengthening cooperation with the Moldovan authorities on cases of serious cross-border crime. The new Liaison Prosecutor for Norway is set to continue the strong cooperation on judicial matters that dates back to 2005, when Norway became the first country to sign a cooperation agreement with Eurojust.

The new Liaison Prosecutor for Norway is set to continue the strong cooperation on judicial matters that dates back to 2005, when Norway became the first country to sign a cooperation agreement with Eurojust.

content.value: The posting of the first Moldovan Liaison Prosecutor is based on the cooperation agreement between the Republic of Moldova and Eurojust, which was signed in July 2014 and entered into force in October 2016. Judicial cooperation between Moldovan authorities and Eurojust has increased significantly in the past five years: between 2018 and 2022, 91 cases involving Moldova were registered at Eurojust. entries.title: Vincent Jamin appointed Administrative Director of Eurojust

title_detail.value: Vincent Jamin appointed Administrative Director of Eurojust

entries.summary: Vincent JaminThe College of Eurojust appointed Mr Vincent Jamin as new Administrative Director of the Agency today. Mr Jamin is a French prosecutor by profession. He brings with him 25 years of experience in the area of criminal justice, ranging from assignments in the French Ministry of Justice (2003-2010) to several high-level positions at Eurojust since 2010. Before becoming Administrative Director of Eurojust, he served as the head of the Agency’s Operations Department since 2018.

He brings with him 25 years of experience in the area of criminal justice, ranging from assignments in the French Ministry of Justice (2003-2010) to several high-level positions at Eurojust since 2010. Before becoming Administrative Director of Eurojust, he served as the head of the Agency’s Operations Department since 2018.

content.value:
As the Administrative Director of the European Union Agency for Criminal Justice Cooperation, Mr Jamin is responsible for the day-to-day administration and implementation of key organisational developments, such as the recent extension of Eurojust's mandate and its comprehensive digitalisation efforts. He will take up his duties on 1 October 2023, serving a term of four years.

entries.title: Moldovan President visits Eurojust to discuss enhanced judicial cooperation

entries.field_list_image_1: President of Moldova Ms Maia Sandu with Eurojust President Mr Ladislav Hamran
entries.summary: President Ms Maia Sandu of the Republic of Moldova visited Eurojust today to discuss the country’s cooperation with the Agency and its further integration into the EU’s judicial cooperation architecture. She met with Eurojust President Mr Ladislav Hamran, who underlined the importance of strengthened relationships to effectively fight serious cross-border crime. Ms Sandu was also briefed on Eurojust’s core activities and its support for the accountability efforts for Ukraine.

Through our joint efforts, we aim to ensure that both our country and Europe as a whole remain one step ahead of criminals, underscoring our commitment to justice and security.’

entries.title: Malware network that infected more than 700.000 victims and caused hundreds of millions of dollars in damage worldwide dismantled in multinational law enforcement operation

title_detail.value: Malware network that infected more than 700.000 victims and caused hundreds of millions of dollars in damage worldwide dismantled in multinational law enforcement operation

entries.summary:
The infrastructure of the malware and botnet known as ’Qakbot’ has been taken down in an international operation led by the United States involving actions in the United States, France, Germany, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, Romania and Latvia. The Qakbot malware infected more than 700.000 victim computers, facilitated the delivery of ransomware and caused hundreds of millions of dollars in damage worldwide. This is one of the largest financial and technical disruptions of a botnet infrastructure leveraged by cybercriminals to commit ransomware, financial fraud and other cyber-enabled criminal activity.

The US authorities seized approximately USD 8.6 million (nearly EUR 8 million) in cryptocurrency during the operation. Eurojust and Europol supported the investigation and played a key role in facilitating cross-border cooperation during the action day.

content.value:
According to the investigation, Qakbot (also known as ‘Qbot’ and ‘Pinkslipbot’, among other names) was controlled by a criminal network and was used by other criminals to target critical industries worldwide. The Qakbot malware infects victim computers primarily through spam email messages containing malicious attachments or hyperlinks.



Once it has infected a victim computer, Qakbot can deliver additional malware, including ransomware. The victim computers infected with Qakbot malware are part of a botnet – a network of compromised computers – that allows infected computers to be…

entries.title: Eurojust supports Romania and UK in action against human traffickers

title_detail.value: Eurojust supports Romania and UK in action against human traffickers

entries.field_list_image_1: Seized money: Romanian banknotes laid out on a table
entries.summary: Eurojust and Europol have supported authorities in Romania and the United Kingdom (UK) in an operation against the trafficking of Romanian women for sexual exploitation in the UK. During an action day in both countries, a total of 17 searches were carried out and 6 people were taken to hearings. In addition, one person in the UK was arrested for a wanted circulation. Eight victims were taken to safety, six of whom during the action day and two more in the course of the investigation. The authorities seized large amounts of money, weapons, jewellery and luxury vehicles. In total, 133 officers took part in the operation. Eurojust supported the setting up of a joint investigation team (JIT), which facilitated cross-border judicial cooperation.

During an action day in both countries, a total of 17 searches were carried out and 6 people were taken to hearings. In addition, one person in the UK was arrested for a wanted circulation. Eight victims were taken to safety, six of whom during the action day and two more in the course of the investigation. The authorities seized large amounts of money, weapons, jewellery and luxury vehicles. In total, 133 officers took part in the operation. Eurojust supported the setting up of a joint investigation team (JIT), which facilitated cross-border judicial cooperation.

content.value: Photo credits: Romanian and UK policeThe suspects allegedly recruited their victims among low-income families in Romania. The criminals used the so-called ‘loverboy’ approach, a method of trafficking in human beings frequently chosen by similar groups operating from Romania. Lured by false promises of romantic relationships, the young women were transported to London, where they were forced into prostitution. The perpetrators advertised these services on various UK adult websites and used the proceedings for their own benefit.The successful action day on 4 August 2023 was the result of a…

entries.title: New National Member for Finland joins Eurojust

title_detail.value: New National Member for Finland joins Eurojust

entries.summary: Ms Heli Vesaaja has taken up her duties as the new National Member for Finland at Eurojust, replacing Ms Lilja Limingoja. Before this appointment, Ms Vesaaja worked for the Prosecution District of Southern Finland, as a prosecutor since 1997 and as a senior specialised prosecutor since 2019. Since 2007, she has specialised in organised crime, drug trafficking and money laundering. She has actively participated in multiple joint investigation teams.

Before this appointment, Ms Vesaaja worked for the Prosecution District of Southern Finland, as a prosecutor since 1997 and as a senior specialised prosecutor since 2019. Since 2007, she has specialised in organised crime, drug trafficking and money laundering. She has actively participated in multiple joint investigation teams.

content.value:
Commenting on her new role as National Member, Ms Vesaaja said: I am honoured to join Eurojust as the new Finnish National Member. Having prosecuted many cases in my home country with assistance from Eurojust, I know how crucial the role of the Agency is in fighting cross-border organised crime. I look forward to building on the work undertaken by Ms Lilja Limingoja and to meeting my new colleagues at Eurojust.

Ms Vesaaja has been working in the field of international cooperation since 2002. In addition to her career as a prosecutor, Ms Vesaaja has worked at the European Court of Human…

entries.title: Most wanted Hungarian criminals arrested in Spain with Eurojust support

title_detail.value: Most wanted Hungarian criminals arrested in Spain with Eurojust support

entries.summary: Three Hungarian criminals on Europol’s European Most Wanted list have been arrested by the Hungarian and Spanish authorities in a simultaneous joint action carried out in Spain. The suspects allegedly run a cannabis plantation and processing facility in Hungary. Eurojust supported the investigation and played a key role in facilitating cross-border judicial cooperation during the operation.

summary_detail.value: Three Hungarian criminals on Europol’s European Most Wanted list have been arrested by the Hungarian and Spanish authorities in a simultaneous joint action carried out in Spain. The suspects allegedly run a cannabis plantation and processing facility in Hungary. Eurojust supported the investigation and played a key role in facilitating cross-border judicial cooperation during the operation.

content.value:
Between 2020 and 2021, the suspects allegedly operated a professionally equipped and automated infrastructure for the cultivation and processing of thousands of cannabis plants in Hungary. The Hungarian authorities dismantled the facility in May 2021. During the operation, the authorities seized 165 kg of marijuana and cocaine and assets worth over HUF 380 million (EUR 983,700).



The authorities were able to identify all seven members of the criminal network and arrested two of them soon after the operation. The other five members were placed on Europol’s European Most Wanted list.

entries.title: Spanish Presidency of the Council of the European Union kicks off at Eurojust with a live art performance

title_detail.value: Spanish Presidency of the Council of the European Union kicks off at Eurojust with a live art performance

entries.summary: The Spanish artist Bea Sarrias has painted a portrait of Eurojust’s headquarters as part of a live performance carried out in the hall of the building between 3 and 7 July. The project, called ‘European Light’, is an initiative of the Spanish National Desk at Eurojust, with the support of the Ministry of Justice and the Embassy of Spain in The Hague. It marks the start of the Spanish Presidency of the Council of the European Union, which began on 1 July.

summary_detail.value: The Spanish artist Bea Sarrias has painted a portrait of Eurojust’s headquarters as part of a live performance carried out in the hall of the building between 3 and 7 July. The project, called ‘European Light’, is an initiative of the Spanish National Desk at Eurojust, with the support of the Ministry of Justice and the Embassy of Spain in The Hague. It marks the start of the Spanish Presidency of the Council of the European Union, which began on 1 July.

content.value:
The painting aims to capture the diverse and changing light of Europe as a metaphor for the need to work together within the EU. The artist was inspired by the light in the building, the colours of the surroundings and Eurojust’s staff, who were able to interact with the artist and watch the entire artistic process unfold. The painting will be on display at Eurojust until the end of the year.

entries.title: History in the making – the International Centre for the Prosecution of the Crime of Aggression Against Ukraine starts operations at Eurojust

title_detail.value: History in the making – the International Centre for the Prosecution of the Crime of Aggression Against Ukraine starts operations at Eurojust

entries.summary:
Marking a historic moment, the International Centre for the Prosecution of the Crime of Aggression Against Ukraine (ICPA) officially started operations today at Eurojust. The ICPA will support the preparation of crime of aggression cases, by securing crucial evidence and facilitating the process of case building at an early stage.

At a dedicated launch event on 3 July at Eurojust’s premises in The Hague, the ICPA was inaugurated by Eurojust’s President Ladislav Hamran, European Commissioner for Justice Didier Reynders, Prosecutor General of Ukraine Andriy Kostin, ICC Prosecutor Karim A.A. Khan, Assistant Attorney General Kenneth A. Polite, and Justice Minister of the Netherlands Ms Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. At the same time, a contribution agreement with the European Commission’s Service for Foreign Policy Instruments was signed and the Centre’s first operational kick-off meeting took place.

entries.title: Lá dár saol é — cuireadh tús le hoibríochtaí an Lárionad Idirnáisiúnta um Ionchúiseamh Choir an Fhogha faoin Úcráin ag Eurojust

title_detail.value: Lá dár saol é — cuireadh tús le hoibríochtaí an Lárionad Idirnáisiúnta um Ionchúiseamh Choir an Fhogha faoin Úcráin ag Eurojust

entries.summary:
Ba eachtra mhór stairiúil é nuair a chuir an Lárionad Idirnáisiúnta um Ionchúiseamh Choir an Fhogha faoin Úcráin (ICPA) tús oifigiúil inniu le hoibríochtaí ag Eurojust. Tacóidh ICPA le cásanna um choir an fhogha a ullmhú, trí fhianaise ríthábhachtach a dhaingniú agus tríd an bpróiseas de thógáil cásanna a éascú ag céim luath.

Ag ócáid seolta tiomnaithe an 3 Iúil ag áitreabh Eurojust sa Háig, osclaíodh an ICPA go hoifigiúil leis an Uachtarán Eurojust, Ladislav Hamran, an Coimisinéir Eorpach um Cheartas Didier Reynders, Ionchúisitheoir Ginearálta na hÚcráine Andriy Kostin, Ionchúisitheoir na Cúirte Coiriúla Idirnáisiúnta Karim A.A. Khan, Ard-Aighne Cúnta Kenneth A. Polite, agus Aire Dlí agus Cirt na hÍsiltíre Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. Ag an am céanna, síníodh comhaontú ranníocaíochta le Seirbhís an Choimisiúin Eorpaigh um Ionstraimí Beartais Eachtraigh agus reáchtáladh an chéad chruinniú tosaigh oibríochtúil ag an Lárionad.

entries.title: Tiek veidota vēsture — Starptautiskais centrs saukšanai pie atbildības par agresijas noziegumu pret Ukrainu sāk darbību aģentūrā Eurojust

title_detail.value: Tiek veidota vēsture — Starptautiskais centrs saukšanai pie atbildības par agresijas noziegumu pret Ukrainu sāk darbību aģentūrā Eurojust

entries.summary:
Atzīmējot vēsturisku brīdi, Starptautiskais centrs saukšanai pie atbildības par agresijas noziegumu pret Ukrainu (ICPA) šodien oficiāli uzsāka darbību aģentūrā Eurojust. ICPA atbalstīs agresijas nozieguma lietu sagatavošanu, nodrošinot svarīgus pierādījumus un atvieglojot lietu izveides procesu agrīnā posmā.

Īpašā atklāšanas pasākumā 3. jūlijā Eurojust telpās Hāgā ICPA centru atklāja Eurojust priekšsēdētājs Ladislav Hamran, Eiropas tieslietu komisārs Didier Reynders, Ukrainas ģenerālprokurors Andriy Kostin, Starptautiskās Krimināltiesas prokurors Karim A.A. Khan, ģenerālprokurora palīgs Kenneth A. Polite un Nīderlandes tieslietu ministre Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. Vienlaikus tika parakstīts ieguldījuma līgums ar Eiropas Komisijas Ārpolitikas instrumentu dienestu un notika centra pirmā darbības uzsākšanas sanāksme.

entries.title: Un eveniment istoric – Centrul internațional pentru urmărirea în justiție a crimei de agresiune împotriva Ucrainei își începe activitatea la Eurojust

title_detail.value: Un eveniment istoric – Centrul internațional pentru urmărirea în justiție a crimei de agresiune împotriva Ucrainei își începe activitatea la Eurojust

entries.summary:
Marcând un moment istoric, Centrul internațional pentru urmărirea în justiție a crimei de agresiune împotriva Ucrainei (ICPA) și-a început astăzi oficial activitatea la Eurojust. ICPA va sprijini pregătirea cazurilor de crimă de agresiune, obținând probe esențiale și facilitând procesul de instrumentare a cauzei într-un stadiu incipient.

În cadrul unui eveniment de lansare special organizat la 3 iulie la sediul Eurojust de la Haga, ICPA a fost inaugurat de președintele Eurojust, Ladislav Hamran, de comisarul european pentru justiție, Didier Reynders, de procurorul general al Ucrainei, Andriy Kostin, de procurorul CPI, Karim A.A. Khan, de procurorul general adjunct, Kenneth A. Polite, și de ministrul Justiției din Țările de Jos, dna Dilan Yeșilgöz-Zegerius. În același timp, a fost semnat un acord de contribuție cu Serviciul Instrumente de Politică Externă al Comisiei Europene și a avut loc prima reuniune operațională de lansare a centrului.

entries.title: Ein historischer Schritt – Das Internationale Zentrum für die Strafverfolgung des Verbrechens der Aggression gegen die Ukraine nimmt bei Eurojust seine Tätigkeit auf

title_detail.value: Ein historischer Schritt – Das Internationale Zentrum für die Strafverfolgung des Verbrechens der Aggression gegen die Ukraine nimmt bei Eurojust seine Tätigkeit auf

entries.summary:
Das Internationale Zentrum für die Strafverfolgung des Verbrechens der Aggression gegen die Ukraine (ICPA) nahm heute offiziell seine Tätigkeit bei Eurojust auf – ein Ereignis von historischer Tragweite. Das ICPA wird zur Vorbereitung von Strafverfahren wegen Verbrechen der Aggression beitragen, indem es wichtiges Beweismaterial sichert und die Fallbearbeitung in einem frühen Stadium unterstützt.

Am 3. Juli wurde das ICPA in den Räumlichkeiten von Eurojust in Den Haag feierlich eröffnet. Ansprachen hielten der Eurojust-Präsident Ladislav Hamran, der EU-Kommissar für Justiz Didier Reynders, der Generalstaatsanwalt der Ukraine Andriy Kostin, der Ankläger des Internationalen Strafgerichtshofs Karim A. A. Khan, der stellvertretende US-Generalstaatsanwalt Kenneth A. Polite und die Justizministerin der Niederlande, Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. Am selben Tag wurde eine Beitragsvereinbarung mit dem Dienst für außenpolitische Instrumente der Europäischen Kommission unterzeichnet und die erste operative Auftaktsitzung des Zentrums abgehalten.

entries.title: Historiaa tekemässä – Ukrainaan kohdistuneen hyökkäysrikoksen syytteeseenpanoon liittyvä kansainvälinen keskus aloittaa toimintansa Eurojustissa

title_detail.value: Historiaa tekemässä – Ukrainaan kohdistuneen hyökkäysrikoksen syytteeseenpanoon liittyvä kansainvälinen keskus aloittaa toimintansa Eurojustissa

entries.summary:
Tänään tehtiin historiaa, kun Ukrainaan kohdistuneen hyökkäysrikoksen syytteeseenpanoon liittyvä kansainvälinen keskus aloitti virallisesti toimintansa Eurojustissa. Keskus tukee oikeustapausten valmistelua hyökkäysrikoksesta turvaamalla ratkaisevan tärkeän todistusaineiston ja helpottamalla tapauksen rakentamista varhaisessa vaiheessa.

Eurojustin tiloissa Haagissa 3. heinäkuuta järjestetyssä avajaistilaisuudessa Eurojustin puheenjohtaja Ladislav Hamran, oikeusasioista vastaava Euroopan komission jäsen Didier Reynders, Ukrainan valtakunnansyyttäjä Andriy Kostin, Kansainvälisen rikostuomioistuimen syyttäjä Karim A. A. Khan, Yhdysvaltain apulaisoikeusministeri Kenneth A. Polite ja Alankomaiden oikeusministeri Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius vihkivät keskuksen käyttöön. Samalla allekirjoitettiin rahoitussopimus Euroopan komission ulkopolitiikan välineiden hallinnon kanssa ja pidettiin keskuksen ensimmäinen operatiivinen aloituskokous.

entries.title: Un evento storico: il centro internazionale per il perseguimento del crimine di aggressione nei confronti dell’Ucraina diventa operativo presso Eurojust

title_detail.value: Un evento storico: il centro internazionale per il perseguimento del crimine di aggressione nei confronti dell’Ucraina diventa operativo presso Eurojust

entries.summary:
Oggi il centro internazionale per il perseguimento del crimine di aggressione nei confronti dell’Ucraina (ICPA) segna un momento storico, diventando ufficialmente operativo presso Eurojust. L’ICPA contribuirà all’istruzione dei procedimenti per il crimine di aggressione, raccogliendo prove determinanti e agevolando il processo di preparazione delle cause in una fase iniziale.

Il 3 luglio, nel corso di un evento di presentazione dedicato presso la sede di Eurojust a L’Aia, l’ICPA è stato inaugurato dal presidente di Eurojust Ladislav Hamran, dal commissario europeo per la Giustizia Didier Reynders, dal procuratore generale dell’Ucraina Andriy Kostin, dal procuratore della Corte penale internazionale Karim A.A. Khan, dal procuratore generale aggiunto Kenneth A. Polite e dal ministro della Giustizia dei Paesi Bassi Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. Contestualmente è stato sottoscritto un accordo di contributo con il servizio degli strumenti di politica estera della Commissione europea e si è svolta la prima riunione operativa di avvio del centro.

entries.title: Jesteśmy świadkami historii – Międzynarodowe Centrum Ścigania Zbrodni Agresji przeciwko Ukrainie rozpoczyna działalność w Eurojuście

title_detail.value: Jesteśmy świadkami historii – Międzynarodowe Centrum Ścigania Zbrodni Agresji przeciwko Ukrainie rozpoczyna działalność w Eurojuście

entries.summary:
To historyczny moment – Międzynarodowe Centrum Ścigania Zbrodni Agresji przeciwko Ukrainie (ICPA) oficjalnie rozpoczęło dziś działalność w Eurojuście. ICPA będzie wspierać przygotowanie spraw dotyczących zbrodni agresji, zabezpieczając kluczowe dowody i ułatwiając proces budowania sprawy na wczesnym etapie.

3 lipca w siedzibie Eurojustu w Hadze podczas uroczystego otwarcia działalność ICPA zainaugurowali: przewodniczący Eurojustu Ladislav Hamran, europejski komisarz do spraw wymiaru sprawiedliwości Didier Reynders, prokurator generalny Ukrainy Andrij Kostin, prokurator Międzynarodowego Trybunału Karnego Karim A.A. Khan, zastępca prokuratora generalnego Kenneth A. Polite i minister sprawiedliwości Holandii Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. Przy tej okazji podpisano także umowę o współpracy ze Służbą ds. Instrumentów Polityki Zagranicznej Komisji Europejskiej i odbyło się pierwsze spotkanie inaugurujące działalność Centrum.

entries.title: Ett historiskt ögonblick – det internationella centrumet för lagföring av aggressionsbrottet mot Ukraina inleder sin verksamhet vid Eurojust

title_detail.value: Ett historiskt ögonblick – det internationella centrumet för lagföring av aggressionsbrottet mot Ukraina inleder sin verksamhet vid Eurojust

entries.summary:
I dag inledde det internationella centrumet för lagföring av aggressionsbrottet mot Ukraina (ICPA) officiellt sin verksamhet vid Eurojust, vilket är ett historiskt ögonblick. ICPA kommer att stödja förberedelserna av aggressionsbrottsmål genom att säkra avgörande bevis och stärka förutsättningarna att nå resultat i ett tidigt skede.

ICPA invigdes vid ett särskilt evenemang i Eurojusts lokaler i Haag den 3 juli av Eurojusts ordförande Ladislav Hamran, EU:s kommissionär för rättsliga frågor Didier Reynders, Ukrainas riksåklagare Andrij Kostin, Internationella brottsmålsdomstolens åklagare Karim A.A. Khan, Förenta staternas biträdande justitieminister Kenneth A. Polite och Nederländernas justitieminister Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. Samtidigt undertecknades ett bidragsavtal med Europeiska kommissionens tjänst för utrikespolitiska instrument, och centrumets första operativa möte ägde rum.

entries.title: Historický okamžik – Mezinárodní středisko pro stíhání zločinu agrese vůči Ukrajině spadající pod Eurojust zahajuje činnost

title_detail.value: Historický okamžik – Mezinárodní středisko pro stíhání zločinu agrese vůči Ukrajině spadající pod Eurojust zahajuje činnost

entries.summary:
Dnešní den se zapíše do historie jako den, kdy oficiálně zahájilo svou činnost Mezinárodní středisko pro stíhání zločinu agrese vůči Ukrajině (ICPA) zřízené v rámci Agentury Evropské unie pro justiční spolupráci v trestních věcech (Eurojust). Úkolem střediska ICPA je včas zajišťovat klíčové důkazy a shromažďovat podklady k přípravě obžaloby pro následné stíhání pachatelů zločinu agrese.

Slavnostního zahájení se 3. července v sídle agentury Eurojust v Haagu zúčastnil její předseda Ladislav Hamran, evropský komisař pro spravedlnost Didier Reynders, generální prokurátor Ukrajiny Andrij Kostin, žalobce Mezinárodního trestního soudu Karim A. A. Khan, náměstek amerického ministra spravedlnosti pro oblast trestního práva Kenneth A. Polite a nizozemská ministryně spravedlnosti Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegeriusová. Současně byla podepsána dohoda o přiznání příspěvku se Službou nástrojů zahraniční politiky Evropské komise a uskutečnilo se zahajovací koordinační jednání střediska.

entries.title: Forjando Historia: el Centro Internacional para el Enjuiciamiento del Crimen de Agresión contra Ucrania inicia sus actividades en Eurojust

title_detail.value: Forjando Historia: el Centro Internacional para el Enjuiciamiento del Crimen de Agresión contra Ucrania inicia sus actividades en Eurojust

entries.summary:
A fecha de hoy, en lo que puede calificarse como un momento histórico, el Centro Internacional para el Enjuiciamiento del Crimen de Agresión contra Ucrania (ICPA) ha iniciado oficialmente sus actividades en Eurojust. El ICPA prestará apoyo en la preparación de expedientes relacionados con los crímenes de agresión, asegurando pruebas cruciales y facilitando el proceso de instrucción del asunto en una fase inicial.

En el acto de presentación específico, celebrado el 3 de julio en las instalaciones de Eurojust en La Haya, el ICPA ha sido inaugurado por el presidente de Eurojust, Ladislav Hamran, el comisario europeo de Justicia, Didier Reynders, el fiscal general de Ucrania, Andriy Kostin, el fiscal de la CPI, Karim A.A. Khan, el Fiscal General Adjunto, Kenneth A. Polite, y la Ministra de Justicia de los Países Bajos, Sra. Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius. A su vez, se ha firmado un convenio de contribución con el Servicio de Instrumentos de Política Exterior de la Comisión Europea y se ha celebrado la primera reunión operativa del Centro.

entries.title: Povijesni trenutak – Međunarodni centar za kazneni progon zločina agresije protiv Ukrajine započinje s radom u Eurojustu

title_detail.value: Povijesni trenutak – Međunarodni centar za kazneni progon zločina agresije protiv Ukrajine započinje s radom u Eurojustu

entries.summary:
Obilježavajući povijesni trenutak, Međunarodni centar za kazneni progon zločina agresije protiv Ukrajine (ICPA) danas je službeno započeo s radom u Eurojustu. ICPA će podržavati pripremu optužnica za zločin agresije osiguravanjem ključnih dokaza i olakšavanjem pripreme predmeta u ranoj fazi.

Na posebnom otvorenju 3. srpnja u prostorijama Eurojusta u Haagu, ICPA-u su otvorili predsjednik Eurojusta Ladislav Hamran, europski povjerenik za pravosuđe Didier Reynders, ukrajinski glavni tužitelj Andrij Kostin, tužitelj Međunarodnog kaznenog suda Karim A. A. Khan, pomoćnik glavnog državnog odvjetnika SAD-a Kenneth A. Polite i nizozemska ministrica pravosuđa Dilan Yeșilgöz-Zegerius. Istodobno je potpisan sporazum o doprinosu sa Službom Europske komisije za instrumente vanjske politike i održan je prvi operativni uvodni sastanak ICPA-e.
